author: alexssd7fp
content: Does 1559 solves the transaction being stuck when it was broadcasted during the raising gas price?

author: pietjepuk
content: Not in and of itself. If you set the `maxFeePerGas` to 2 x the current base fee, and the next 6 blocks are (doubly) full with txs that have higher `maxPriorityFeePerGas`, then you're out of luck.

author: alexssd7fp
content: Rip then

author: alexssd7fp
content: Sending ethereum transactions without rebroadcasting them with higher gas price seems to be impossible

author: pietjepuk
content: Not sure what you mean to be honest.

author: alexssd7fp
content: We send 1000+ transactions daily

author: alexssd7fp
content: Every one hour

author: alexssd7fp
content: And every one or two days the payouts are stuck

author: alexssd7fp
content: Because of the stupid gas price increase

author: alexssd7fp
content: Rebroadcasting them is the only way to get them through

author: pietjepuk
content: Why not send them with a higher `maxFeePerGas` then? (hypothetically after London)

author: alexssd7fp
content: I have no idea what `maxFeePerGas` is sorry

author: pietjepuk
content:
(I'm also not sure what you mean with "payouts". Obviously not mining pool -> miner payouts, as those would never be stuck)

OK, so why not send with a higher gas price? (talking in current terms)

author: alexssd7fp
content: ah yes payouts

author: alexssd7fp
content: we are a mining pool

author: alexssd7fp
content: payouts = transactions

author: pietjepuk
content: How can those be stuck if _you're_ the one mining them?

author: alexssd7fp
content: We are not mining them

author: alexssd7fp
content: Because that would essentially make miners earning less

author: alexssd7fp
content: Constantly fluctuating gas price is the single thing I hate the most in ethereum

author: pietjepuk
content: Just set the `maxFeePerGas` to the maximum you're willing to pay then, and get a rebate for the difference.

author: alexssd7fp
content: Yeah I guess this is what we will use

author: alexssd7fp
content: After 1559 is out

author: pietjepuk
content: Currently you indeed have to guess rather accurately, as there's no rebate if you overestimated

author: alexssd7fp
content: If it was not burning the base fee, I'd absolutely love this eip

author: alexssd7fp
content:
> Currently you indeed have to guess rather accurately
Using gas price oracle equal to gasnow's Rapid gas price

author: alexssd7fp
content: Still gets stuck üòµ

author: pietjepuk
content: Yeh, so at least EIP-1559 will make that a bit better. I'm not entirely convinced it's cheaper to let other pools mine your payouts though, I'd say the cost is the same (or slightly cheaper if you include them yourself probably). And at least they don't get stuck.

author: alexssd7fp
content: It is profitable to include the highest paying transactions

author: alexssd7fp
content: And if we will include our transactions with the gas price of 28.9 gwei currently

author: alexssd7fp
content: obviously it will be less profitable

author: alexssd7fp
content: Miners would kill us if they would see this üòÇ

author: pietjepuk
content: This discussion has also come up repeatedly a few months back, with some mining pools thinking payouts were gonna get more expensive with EIP-1559. I don't think there's a way around paying roughly `<highest paying but not-included tx in mining pool> * 21k` for every payout.

author: alexssd7fp
content: this is possible, though, it will introduce hell a lot of complexity since we will need to sign transactions on the fly and include them to our blocks

author: alexssd7fp
content: and the more complex the system is, the more chances that it will fuck up

author: alexssd7fp
content: and we cannot let it be true

author: alexssd7fp
content: cos we have tons of eth on the mining address

author: pietjepuk
content: It's fine if you let other pools mine the payouts, just saying that the costs are about the same üôÇ

author: pietjepuk
content: Anyway, this is way off topic for EIP-1559.

author: alexssd7fp
content: Yeah, but this doesn't apply to the current case haha

author: alexssd7fp
content: The market gas price is 90 gwei whereas our transactions are 28 gwei

author: alexssd7fp
content: Yeah haha

author: alexssd7fp
content: Fingers crossed that 1559 will fix that

author: brad.decker
content: Sorry to bump this again but could someone help me out with understanding the implications of EIP-1559 on submitting new transactions with same nonce in an attempt to supersede the original transaction? Also would probably be beneficial to wallet devs to include in <@!420951281910284289>  and <@!552133098075193354> 's cheat sheet (which I love, thank you üôèüèª )
